definition: to take a vacation/to go on holiday
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: They only let me out on patrol when they're shorthanded .
sentences.chinese: 很多人這個月休假中，所以我們有一點人手短缺。

sentences.english: I'm taking Thursday off to do some Christmas shopping.
sentences.chinese: 我週四要休假去買一些聖誕禮品。

sentences.english: It was also announced that all police leave has been cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 同時，所有休假的警察都已被要求回崗加班。

sentences.english: Labourers who have worked for one successive year or more shall be entitled to an annual vacation with pay.
sentences.chinese: 勞動者連續工作一年以上的，享受帶薪年休假。

sentences.english: That seaside hotel charges exorbitant prices during the summer holidays.
sentences.chinese: 那家海濱旅館在夏天休假期間漫天要價。

sentences.english: "Workers paid annual leave regulations" promulgated at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 《職工帶薪年休假條例》同時出臺。

sentences.english: Allow jail time to be covered under family medical leave policy.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭醫療休假政策中加上探監時間。

sentences.english: The vacation request form describes a service contract.
sentences.chinese: 休假申請單描述了一個服務契約。

sentences.english: What are the provisions on foreign experts ' dimission allowance?
sentences.chinese: 外國文教專家在華工作期間可享受哪些節日休假？

sentences.english: “I couldn’t find the positive thing, ” she said of her sabbatical.
sentences.chinese: “我找不到積極的事情”她提到她的休假。

sentences.english: The week after next we're closed for vacation.
sentences.chinese: 下下週，我們會關店去休假。

sentences.english: I (amn't sleeping) well. i want to take a holiday. (not sleep)
sentences.chinese: 近來我睡覺不好，我想休假。

sentences.english: Jon took over the day - to - day responsibilities of his vacationing coworker .
sentences.chinese: 阿強的同事休假去，由他代理日常事務。

sentences.english: Let me seek someone to supply when you having a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 你休假期間，我設法找個人來接替一下你的工作吧。

sentences.english: Hotel workers wait until the off-season to take their holidays.
sentences.chinese: 旅館工作人員等到淡季再休假。

sentences.english: He then said he would take a six-month leave of absence.
sentences.chinese: 然後表示他將要休假六個月。

definition: to have a holiday or vacation
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
to receive one's regular salary (while on vacation, study leave etc)/paid (leave)/on full pay
to compensate for working on a holiday by resting on a workday/to compensate for resting on a workday by working on a holiday
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to go on an official or business trip
